1.brief: a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
literally a failure of flesh, i.e. emaciation; figuratively, hypocrisy
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to withdraw (both literally and figuratively, whether intransitive or transitive)
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food

2.brief: a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
properly, to stamp, i.e. to spring about (wildly or for joy)

3.brief: a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword
a lance (for thrusting, like pitching a tent)
a carcase (as limp), whether of man or beast; figuratively, an idolatrous image
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a body, whether alive or dead
to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
a body, whether alive or dead

4.brief: to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)
to sell, literally (as merchandise, a daughter in marriage, into slavery), or figuratively (to surrender)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
a family, i.e. circle of relatives; figuratively, a class (of persons), a species (of animals) or sort (of things); by extension a tribe or people

5.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
a skirt; by implication, a bottom edge
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
a nude place, i.e. (literally) the pudenda, or (figuratively) a vacant space
dominion, i.e. (abstractly) the estate (rule) or (concretely) the country (realm)

6.brief: to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
disgusting, i.e. filthy; especially idolatrous or (concretely) an idol
to wilt; generally, to fall away, fail, faint; figuratively, to be foolish or (morally) wicked; causatively, to despise, disgrace
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
sight, whether abstractly (vision) or concretely (a spectacle)

7.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to nod, i.e. waver; figuratively, to wander, flee, disappear; also (from shaking the head in sympathy), to console, deplore, or (from tossing the head in scorn) taunt
where? (only in connection with prepositional prefix, whence)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)

8.brief: to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right)
No (i.e. Thebes), the capital of Upper Egypt
Amon (i.e. Ammon or Amn), a deity of Egypt
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a channel, e.g. a fosse, canal, shaft; specifically the Nile, as the one river of Egypt, including its collateral trenches; also the Tigris, as the main river of Assyria
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
an army; also (by analogy,) an intrenchment

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

9.brief: Cush (or Ethiopia), the name of a son of Ham, and of his territory; also of an Israelite
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
Put, a son of Ham, also the name of his descendants or their region, and of a Persian tribe
a Libyan or inhabitant of interior Africa (only in plural)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

10.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
exiled; captured; as noun, exile (abstractly or concretely and collectively); by extension, booty
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
properly, to handle, i.e. to throw, e.g. lots
properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
properly, what leaps forth, i.e. flash of fire, or a burning arrow; also (from the original sense of the root) a bond

11.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to become tipsy; in a qualified sense, to satiate with astimulating drink or (figuratively) influence
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to veil from sight, i.e. conceal (literally or figuratively)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
a fortified place; figuratively, a defence

12.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

13.brief: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
an opening, i.e. door or gate
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

14.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
something hemming in, i.e. (objectively) a mound (of besiegers), (abstractly) a siege, (figuratively) distress; or (subjectively) a fastness
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to tread upon (as a potter, in walking or abusively)
properly, a bubbling up, i.e. of water, a wave; of earth, mire or clay (cement); also a heap; hence, a chomer or dry measure
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer

15.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
a devourer; specifically, the young locust
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
a devourer; specifically, the young locust
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)

16.brief: a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
a devourer; specifically, the young locust
to spread out (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to strip (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.)
to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning)

17.brief: the locust (from its grubbing as a larvae)
the locust (from its grubbing as a larvae)
properly, to incline; by implication, to decline (of the slanting rays of evening); specifically, to pitch atent; gen. to encamp (for abode or siege)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
properly, to irradiate (or shoot forth beams), i.e. to rise (as the sun); specifically, to appear (as a symptom of leprosy)
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

18.brief: to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

19.brief: a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, a weakening; figuratively, alleviation, i.e. cure
a fracture, figuratively, ruin; specifically, a solution (of a dream)
properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
a wound; figuratively, carnage, also pestilence
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
something heard, i.e. a sound, rumor, announcement; abstractly, audience
to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice
